spatial_accuracy.notes: Overall layout (4 bedrooms around a central living/dining with kitchen + utility below) is broadly consistent, but several plan-specific placements drift in the 3D. The bottom service band (H.O + small toilet + adjacent walls) does not read as the same arrangement as the 2D plan (E1/E2/E4). Some internal wall alignments around the kitchen/utility and the small central toilets appear shifted, changing corridor widths and room shapes (E2/E4). Door locations for multiple rooms appear re-centered/simplified versus the plan’s corner/offset placements (E2/E3). Window/opening extents along the outer façade are exaggerated into large continuous openings/railings compared to the more segmented window runs in plan (E2/E4).

structural_fidelity.notes: Wall thickness is visually consistent, but several door embeddings/clear openings do not match the plan locations (E2/E3). Adjacencies are mostly preserved (bedrooms connect to living/dining/corridors; toilets near respective zones), yet the exact service-core partitioning at the bottom (H.O/toilet cluster) is not faithfully reproduced (E1/E2). No clearly new major rooms are added, but the façade opening treatment and some built-in elements behave like hallucinated architectural modifications rather than plan-driven details (E5).

furniture_mapping.notes: Major furniture intent matches (beds in each bedroom, sofa grouping in living, dining table centered, kitchen counters), but several pieces are placed/rotated to suit the render rather than the exact plan layout (E2/E3). Some furniture scale (notably dining set clearance and cabinetry depth) appears inconsistent with the tighter plan proportions around kitchen/utility (E4).

aesthetic_quality.notes: Isometric camera is acceptable and composition is clear. Projection is not strictly orthographic (perspective present), reducing plan-to-model verification reliability. Lighting is clean and materials are coherent. Geometry is mostly clean, though some openings/rails read as over-smoothed or generalized compared to plan (E6/E4).

detected_errors.description: Bottom-center H.O (6'9"x7') space from the 2D plan is not clearly present as a distinct room in the 3D; the service area reads reconfigured/merged.
Service-core partitions around the kitchen/utility and adjacent small toilets are shifted compared to the 2D plan, altering corridor alignment and room boundaries.
Multiple door placements/orientations appear simplified or re-centered in 3D versus the plan’s offset/corner door positions (notably bedroom and small toilet entries).
Room and opening proportions deviate: façade openings/balconies are rendered as larger, more continuous spans than indicated by the segmented window lines in the 2D plan.
Balcony/railing and exterior opening treatments appear embellished beyond the plan, functioning as quasi-hallucinated architectural elements rather than exact plan-derived window/door extents.
Non-orthographic (perspective) rendering and generalized opening geometry reduce precision for strict plan fidelity verification.
